intro: Lachnopylis odorata, commonly known as the sweet sarsapilla, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its aromatic, yellowish-green leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and in open woods. Its foliage emits a subtle, sweet scent, which is most noticeable when the leaves are crushed. Lachnopylis odorata is often used in traditional herbal remedies for its purported medicinal properties.
